title: Sampler, 1796
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in chain, feather, couching, stem, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation
inscribed:
Jamesscoll (?) for W. L. Kenney, Nov. 1 1796
Worked by Elizabeth Mercer, Nov. 1- 25, 1796
provenance:
Ex. coll. Fraser/Martin. Bought from a friend of Mrs. Wiltbank, Boston 1922. Her grandmother's sampler. 
Donor note: Bought in Boston 1922 from friend of Mrs. Wilkbank, her grandmother's sampler.
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description: A cornucopia is spilling an assortment of flowers; it is surrounded by butterflies and birds. An estucheon below the cornucopia is inscribed Jamesscoll (?) for W.L. Kenney, Nov. 1, 1796,  and an inscription appears in the lower left corner: Worked by Elizabeth Mercer, Nov. 1- 25 1796. With a traliling floral vine border on all sides. The fabric has been pieced: the field and borders are not of the same foundation fabric.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1796.
1796. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in chain, feather, couching, stem, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1975-81-2.
